text: Hi. I hit a strange problem for CRM Search API today. No matter what filter values I provided, zero results are returned. It was still functioning few days ago. But when I test the same call with my sandbox account, no problems occurred. Does anyone have ideas?
Hi! Anyone knows a way to add javascript file to every page and blog post through API?
Hi Eric, are you still experiencing this issue?
Great news, thank you for letting me know Eric :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi There - my first post:). Using the Deal API I am attempting to get the deal owner back, it does not seem to work as advertised, any input?  <https://api.hubapi.com/deals/v1/deal/paged?hapikey=xxx&includeAssociations=true&limit=2&properties=HubSpot_owner_id>

Hello! Could anyone from HubSpot take a look at <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Call-dispositions-API-endpoint-doesn-t-return-correct-list-of/m-p/342337#M33472> -> seems like <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/get-call-dispositions> endpoint doesn't work as intended
Hey Chris, here is the api call i just made and got list of deals with only owner property: GET <https://api.hubapi.com/deals/v1/deal/paged?limit=2&properties=HubSpot_owner_id>
looks like 1 difference: we use OAuth
<@UDU6KEBFB> I think if you post the file to ‘filemanager/api/v2/files?hidden=true’ then it wont be public
you can find the explanation here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/files/post_files>

has anyone been able to figure out a way to determine whether an email was inbound or outbound from the API? It seems like there is only an property for "Email" and the counter doesn't care whether the email was inbound or outbound.

If anyone has a solution for figuring out how to track the number of inbound emails a contact has had with the user, that would be amazing.
